title: Bronze - Gold Players: Tell me why you think you can't climb solo queue
body:
I'm doing a fair bit of research into why bronze - gold players feel like they are stuck in the Elo they are in.

The Question... What is holding you back from climbing solo queue?

What is/are the biggest weaknesses you face in your or others gameplay? and why.

In other words... If I could change this...  I would win more games...

Try to stay away from statements like "My team sucks" "Nothing but trolls" "5 AFK's in a row"

http://leaguetales.com/ is where you can find the majority of my work and thoughts, Thanks

replies.body: I'm Gold 5 sitting on a 43W-21L record and a ~Gold 2 MMR as a solo-only player. I really haven't noticed things like "DQ is holding me back" or "team always feeds". I probably could climb to high gold, maybe even low plat, but I'm under no illusion that I'm a high Plat/ low Diamond player. My problem is that I one-trick in ranked because I'm confident on my ability to carry with Wukong. But I get bored of playing the same champ so I end up playing a bunch of random shit in norms and ARAM because this is a game after all. You're supposed to have fun playing a game. Not be miserable trying to grind through ranks
Wukong man. One of the most underrated champs in SQ. Especially with all the Olaf spams now.
Enjoy it while you can. Wukong is one of the biggest abusers of flat AD pen, so the changes are gonna hurt him. Definitely won't be weak, but definitely wont be as strong as he is now.
lethality is stronger then armor pen, lol
It's not lol. It's a straight up nerfed form of flat armor pen
It is, lol, lethality jhin and lucian are even more broke then they were when it was armor pen, they made it a bit weaker early on, but made it scale a whole lot better

The point of those armor pen builds on Jhin and Lucian is to snowball off of the huge early game power of armor pen. Lethality is taking that away in favor of a smoother power curve overall. This will likely push most pen adcs back towards crit builds.
Excellent, so anybody can climb to a decent elo if they simply master the ins and outs of one champion? That's a great synopsis

Well it sure helps. You don't neccessarily need to one-trick, but having like 2 dedicated mains in the 2 roles you queue for helps a lot. I see sooooooooooooooooo many bronze/silver players with like 50 different champions played in a season and I don't know why. It's so much easier when you already know how to play a lane so you can focus on other things like the macro game. For example, if I'm playing Wukong top against a Darius, I already know I can't 1v1 him unless he massively fucks up. So I just farm under turret the best I can, wait for jungle help, or look for a TP roam somewhere. Someone wo has only played Wukong a few times might try to fight Darius and feed him because they don't know any better

Its not that we can't climb, its just that this ELO is such a clown fiesta its a slow-ass climb. There's just too much RNG when it comes to bronze. Your team might be all players that belong in gold, all players that belong in bronze 5, all troll, all diamond smurfs, or some other weird shit.

I believe some of the problem is that the ranked system punishes the player for a mistakes that can be more "team based" (not including the player I just mentioned). So there could be a much broader sea of high ranking players but they cannot climb continuously do to losing. When I say this, I am in no way saying that "Dota isbetterthisiswhyiquitleaguelol" Dota has a MMR rating (not perfect) that scores partially the player, based on how well they perform. That is less stress than being brought down a rank because of your team and having to worry about "can I carry". If you  think about it, and this may sound like something you hear in elementary and middle school, but there is no I in team.  Everyone is supposed to pull their own and work together to win. So that when something is done competitively, rather it be a sport or non-sport, one person is not responsible for making sure that team succeeds. LCS players, don't generally have to worry about that, because they have a team. Right now, it's more of a "Yes there is an I in team" and that is pressure going into every game like that. And it also forces you not to be able to play champs that you want (outside of picks and bans and team competition).

As a Bronze III, I present my reasons:

1. Ranked "mindset." You have this mentality that ranked is scary and such a high-pressure test of skill when in reality it's barely more than your average normal draft game (at least in Bronze).

2. "____ Syndrome" : If you're fed, you think you can 1v5 the entire team and you'll start doing just that and making dumbass mistakes. Commonly known as Yi Syndrome, Yasuo Syndrome, Jax Syndrome etc. Happens with almost every champion.

3. Anger towards others. Instead of focusing on what you did wrong you'll just get mad at another player on your team because you have such an inflated ego about your gameplay. "Oh, I should be in Gold right now." No you shouldn't; if you should be you WOULD be; that's how ranked works. I go by one simple rule: ALWAYS BLAME YOURSELF. Even if the ADC was 0/20, you have to deal with your gameplay EVERY ranked game, while your ADC is different each game.

4. "Potatoes". Let's face it, sometimes you get those people who have NO idea what they're doing. It happens. But see #3 for how to deal with it.

5. The matchmaking. I could be wrong but I'm pretty sure LoL matches you with worse people the more wins you have, to try to balance your wins/losses to 50%. It's frustrating when your MMR is really high and you can go up 2/3 divisions, and then get matched with terrible players. BUT that is testing your ability to carry the team, so I guess it's fair.

6. "Bitching". If there is ONE "broken" champion on the enemy team, everyone starts complaining in chat (including me). "Oh gg ff at 20". If a yasuo shows up (rarely b/c he's always banned) players go crazy. They subconsciously already surrendered; their mind will not be as sharp as it could because of the dread of facing an op champ (who they arbitrarily deem OP).

7. This is the main reason, in my opinion, why bronzies can't climb. THEY DO NOT KNOW HOW TO COUNTER THESE "BROKEN" CHAMPS. If they see a Yasuo, they have absolutely no clue what to do except try to kill him before he kills you. If they see a Katarina you bet they'll be trying to dive her, and then realizing how fed she is after they're 0/3, proceed to be useless the whole game. The Bronze NEED to learn how to counter or at least PLAY against some of these champions. And there is ALWAYS one of these champs on the enemy team, so they're trapped in this state of fear and mental submission.
Main "broken" champs in bronze: {{champion:84}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} . Just the community's opinion based on games. (I personally don't think Yas is that bad but the rest I can see being somewhat "broken.")

Now, I've done all of these things above. I used to be Bronze 5. But I've climbed to Bronze 3 in about 20 games, which I find impressive. The trick to climbing is above. 

And the rule of thumb: DO NOT RAGE AT ALL. DO NOT BE SALTY. 
I used to be a ridiculously toxic player, yelling in chat in all caps constantly. I'm surprised I didn't get reported / chat restricted, honestly. I lost every game, and I thought it was the enemy team. I was 0/10, 0/9, maybe 1/9 if lucky, every game.
Then I tried to see what I could do to improve myself. I practiced constantly in norms, and customs (CS practice). Then I went into a ranked game a month later; it seemed just like a normal. I went 5/4, and I was so excited. I won my first ranked game! I realized I didn't rage at all, even when my team made dumb mistakes. And since then, EVERY SINGLE TIME I have raged in chat, we've lost. So don't do it. Spout curses in the safety of your room, but don't waste your time typing into chat.

That's all folks. 
Tales of a Bronze Player (Who stopped playing Ranked until S7).

I can climb, but I'm lazy.

Last year was my first year of League, and I got placed in Silver 2. It was relatively easy to climb up to Gold as a top/mid main. I didn't go further than Gold 5 because there was no reason for me to go further. All I care about are season rewards, and as I got matched with Platinum players more frequently this season, I don't feel any desire to really make an effort anymore. 

I like the Gold border better than the Platinum one too.

This year I tried to challenge myself since I started earlier in the year than last, so I climbed only as support. It was nice and I've grown dedicated to the role, but I had to learn to play support and carry as support and it took so much more time, especially since I didn't play a high damage support.

I guess this year I don't feel any motivation to push myself any further. I mainly play this game for fun and ranked has just been a nice learning experience. I might try to go further next year, but I genuinely don't feel any desire to push past Gold at the moment.

I think it's a mix of several things.

1) I can't guarantee, absolutely 100%, consistency of conditions (I live in a rural area so I have literally one ISP monopolizing quality of service, and I live with family so if they do ANYTHING bandwidth-hog heavy, I'm completely at the mercy of the enemy, though I generally only play when I'm the only one actually home or up at a ridiculous hour of the night).

2) When I do go on anything resembling a SIGNIFICANT (that's the key word here) win streak, I am then teamed with people who I swear could (and probably WOULD) lose to AI bots. No sense of self-preservation (picking stupid fights all day long, not recalling when it's obvious the tiniest little auto-attack could kill them, forcing unnecessary ganks while severely behind, being baited into everything under the sun, etc.). No idea how to rotate/pressure objectives. The system picks people on losing streaks and crams as many of them as possible for me to force me into a 'carry or negate every inch of ground gained, THEN SOME' because "50% win rate" is the goal the system tries to implement.

3) I don't have anyone to team up with to better my chances because I don't know any real-life friends who also play League outside of one guy who duo'd with his GF to hit Gold and they play side-by-side. Even if I wasn't restricted by who I could queue with, I would still need communication which would eff up the bandwidth as they live on literally the opposite side of the country, putting us at a disadvantage against more formal pre-mades, as in those who co-ordinate via voice communication.

4) I find myself on teams of all solo vs 3+ premades far more often than is the reverse situation. Just last night, it was clear one team was smurfing as they had a 5-man jungle invade, and ended up a 1v5 as literally everyone else on my team fed super hard then afk'd simply from how badly they were out-maneuvering us.

5) I don't play certain champions. Ever. I'm probably the one person in League who finds champions like Master Yi or Zed or Katarina (just to name a few, there's quite a lot of them) hard as fuck to play. My brain just freezes up trying to play these sort of cheesy (spelling?) champions. Maybe it's because I overthink them combined with the fact that I do have some genuine mental co-ordination problems that don't translate well to self-described "fancy moves". I find Fizz to be mechanically simple but if I were to play Zed, I'd feed all day long because there is way too much you technically CAN do with him but everything moves way too fast and is far too combo-oriented. Basically, it's the same reasoning why I can't play fighting games like Street Fighter/Mortal Kombat/Tekken/Soul Calibur/etc.

6) I know I'm not a great player in the wider scope of things, but I play games far better in realistic team environments. Random people who you'll likely never see again apart from maybe one or two more queues immediately after a single given game and being rated solely on wins as opposed to play mechanics within the game makes me feel helpless because you can't force other people to do things. You can only change your own behaviour to suit the needs of the situation but by basic mathematical principles be able to always be able to "cover" for those who are just blatantly bad at the game and have absolutely NO DESIRE TO IMPROVE BUT STILL EXPECT TO WIN BECAUSE THEY FEEL THEY DESERVE IT WITHOUT PUTTING IN ANYWHERE REMOTELY CLOSE TO THE REQUIRED EFFORT.

I screw up a fair bit now and then and I know when a loss is to be pinned on me, not others. I accept that no one wins 100% of their games and it is folly to believe that I supposedly "deserve" to win. But with all of the pressure from every possible angle (and I'm sure I'm missing several key points I forgot to mention), I seriously don't know what I can do. I have lost basically all faith in a fair ranked experience. I don't know why I even try anymore. Maybe I'm just addicted at this point and too stubborn to move on and only play normals from now on? I wish I knew.
G5 I know I can climb to Plat, but I had 8 ranked games in a row with an afk on my team so I'm scared to que up now. If no one afks I can prob carry.

This is a great comment because people under estimate decisive shot calling!

Taking your advantage in lane and immediately applying it to other areas of the map is the easiest way to snowball a win.

Look to roam early and focus early objectives after a advantages have been gained. Don't force them, but simply take them when they are available.

Depending on team compositions, you may need to neglect or thrive on risky plays at certain times.

Normally as an immobile mage I try to draw attention to my lane if I have a huge advantage so team can focus other objectives. It's not always successful.
You'll find that grouping unexpectedly and taking a turret when the enemy has no way of responding to the rotation is a great way to get a big gold lead early.
